result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Michael Ring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file and balance through a payment plan.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: DE called to verify his bal.  Clerk verified a bal of $41.26 to the DE & advised him his next pymt of $25 is due 10-01-17. jaf

DE called to make pymt over the phone.  DE was given his pymt options again & advised to review his Pplan Agmt as all of his pymt options are listed at the bottom & his first pymt is not due until 9-01-16. jaf
Accident Fund Holders ck# 026076 sent this date. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA & NRPD. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 9-01-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Timothy Michael Ring appeared. Case called at 10:20 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Atty Andrea recites agreement. Requesting restitution be paid out of bond money posted. ADA Kelly in agreement. Restitution hearing was held prior with Court Commissioner. Requesting restitution be ordered in the amount of $158.26. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 15CM725. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 15CM725.  Sentencing arguments. State has complied with Victims Rights. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

- Fine inclusive of costs in the amount of $443.00. DE to set up a payment plan. 

- DNA Sample

- Restitution in the amount of $158.26 to be paid to Accident Fund Holdings, Inc. Bond to apply.
Atty. A. Andrea. gme
Signed by P. Brummond on 05-23-2016. gme
